fr.nemolovich.apps.mavendependenciesdownloader

Class DependenciesDownloader

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.nemolovich.apps.mavendependenciesdownloader.DependenciesDownloader

  • public final class DependenciesDownloader
extends Object
    Utilities to download all dependencies of a pom.xml Model.
    Author:
    Nemolovich

    • Method Detail

      • downloadDependencies

        public static void downloadDependencies(org.apache.maven.model.Model model,
                        String outputFolderPath,
                        String... mavenRepoURL)
                                 throws DependenciesException
        Download all dependencies JAR files from a pom Model to an output folder path.
        Parameters:
        model - Model - The pom model.
        outputFolderPath - String - The output folder path.
        mavenRepoURL - String[] - The maven repositories URL to search dependencies.
        Throws:
        DependenciesException - If the output folder path can not be created.

      • getDependenciesFolderFile

        private static File getDependenciesFolderFile(String folderPath)
                                       throws OutputDependcyFileException
        Returns the File used as folder to save to dependencies files downloaed.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - String - The path folder to use.
        Returns:
        File - The output folder as File.
        Throws:
        OutputDependcyFileException - If the folder does not exist and can not be created.

      • writeData

        private static void writeData(org.apache.maven.model.Dependency dependency,
             String[] mavenRepos,
             String downloadName,
             File dependenciesFolder,
             String fileName)
        Download and write data for a download. A Maven dependency will be download from given maven repositories with the download name to the dependecies folder with a new file name.
        Parameters:
        dependency - Dependency - The Maven dependency.
        mavenRepos - String[] - The list or Maven repository to try to download dependency.
        downloadName - String - The dependecy name to download.
        dependenciesFolder - File - The target dependencies folder.
        fileName - String - The target file name.

      • removeEmptyFile

        private static void removeEmptyFile(File file)
        Remove a file if its content is null after download.
        Parameters:
        file - File - The file to check content.

      • downloadFile

        private static void downloadFile(URL dlURL,
                OutputStream dlOut)
                          throws IOException,
                                 KeyManagementException,
                                 NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Download a file from an url to the outputstream.
        Parameters:
        dlURL - URL - The file to download URL.
        dlOut - OutputStream - The output stream to write data.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the file can not be located at the URL or the stream can not be read (or closed) or the data can not be write.
        KeyManagementException
        NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • setTrustManager

        public static void setTrustManager(TrustManager... managers)
        Define a custom trust manager if needed.
        Parameters:
        managers - TrustManager[] - The list of managers to use.

      • getDownloadPath

        private static String getDownloadPath(org.apache.maven.model.Dependency d)
        Format dependency path from Dependency object.
        Parameters:
        d - Dependency - The dependency to format.
        Returns:
        String - The dependency format as {group_id}/{artifact_id}/{version}/{artifact_id}-{version}.jar .

      • neededScopeDependency

        private static boolean neededScopeDependency(String scope)
        If the scope is a scope that required the jar at runtime returns true.

        If the scope is null it takes the default value "compile".

        Parameters:
        scope - String - The scope to check.
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the scope required JAR (like "runtime"), false otherwise (like "test").
